column4: Creationist ain't linux great...now you can get wrong answers in all languages and alphabets....even right-to-left
Just what I was looking for in a futuristic OS ;)
Yeah, that kinda pissed me off about Windows too... I can view any and all files on my Linux drives regardless of permissions.  Kind of defeats the purpose of security, doesn't it?

I'm just saying that I used to think my personal stuff was safe in Linux without my password.  But that's just no even close to true.  All you have to do is throw the drive into a Windows machine and boom... it's all accessible.
My windows partition reads my /home partition (ext3) just fine.
Of course, I had to install a driver for that, but still.
